metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0627 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An information disclosure vulnerability in the kernel UVC driver could enable a local malicious application to access data outside of its permission levels. This issue is rated as Moderate because it first requires compromising a privileged process. Product: Android. Versions: Kernel-3.10, Kernel-3.18. Android ID: A-33300353. Xingyuan Lin discovered that a out-of-bounds read existed in the USB Video Class (UVC) driver of the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-151-generic - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-3.13.0-151-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-3.13.0-151-lowlatency - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-3.13.0-151-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-3.13.0-151-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-3.13.0-151-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-3.13.0-151-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-3.13.0-151-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-151.201
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-151-generic - 3.13.0-151.201
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> fixed differently in 7e09f7d5c790278ab98e5f2c22307ebe8ad6e8ba

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-151.201').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-151.201').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1').
